input_text:
Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst

Location: Watertown, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology

Description:
ABOUT US: Wis-Pak is a leading manufacturer and distributor of Pepsi-Cola and other popular beverage brands. We are a billion-dollar organization offering ample opportunities to drive change, innovate processes, and help shape our company’s future direction. As we continue to expand, we intend to integrate more data-driven decision-making across our operations. To support this vision, we are seeking a proactive and adaptable Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our team. 
ABOUT YOU:Do you aspire to leverage the power of data to influence business outcomes? Are you an analytical thinker and creative problem solver? Can you translate complex data into easy-to-understand terms that will enable better business decisions? Are you a curious learner? Are you comfortable working in evolving business conditions and a fast-paced environment? We are looking for someone who is not afraid to ask critical questions and challenge conventional thinking. Can you work independently, with strong personal accountability?
ABOUT THE JOB:As a BI Analyst, you will play a critical role in shaping the landscape of data utilization within the company. This is a dynamic position within a developing area of our business which means your responsibilities and projects will evolve over time. The ideal candidate will thrive in ambiguous situations, demonstrating a strong ability to adapt and innovate as the role and its demands change. 
WHAT YOU’LL DO:Develop, implement, and maintain BI solutions (reports, dashboards, data models) that enhance decision-making and business performance across various departments.Collaborate with stakeholders to identify business requirements and opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.Analyze large datasets to provide actionable insights and recommendations that address complex business questions.Manage the lifecycle of BI projects from conceptualization to deployment, ensuring adherence to timelines and quality standards.Continuously improve BI tools, systems, and processes through feedback and detailed ongoing analysis.Provide training and support to business users to maximize the utilization of BI technology.Stay updated with industry trends and advancements in BI technologies to suggest and implement best practices.
WHAT YOU’LL BRING TO THE TABLE:Bachelor’s degree in information technology, computer science, data science or business administration1 to 3 years of experience as a BI Analyst, Data Analyst, or similar role in a data-driven environmentStrong proficiency with Power BI or Tableau (SQL a plus)Advanced Excel skills a MUSTExperience in data modeling, data analysis, and data visualizationAbility to communicate complex concepts to non-technical users
WHAT WE OFFER:A dynamic role with room to grow and shape the future of our organizationOpportunity to work with a diverse, cross-functional team that values innovation and creativityCompetitive payComprehensive benefits Flexible work schedule that supports work-life balance
*LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY** U.S. CITIZENS or PERMANENT RESIDENTS ONLY*** This is not a 100% remote position – we value collaboration, and we believe it is best done across the table than across the screen. 
Up for the challenge? Apply here: https://go.cultureindex.com/p/wsnPp8toICk4b9uICWe look forward to discovering how you will make a difference and help us achieve new heights in the industry.

Experience Level (if available): Associate

Collaborate with stakeholders to identify business requirements
Analyze large datasets to provide actionable insights

Continuous improvement of BI tools, systems, and processes
